meanings.definition: A navigational instrument used to measure the angle between two objects, typically the horizon and a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The sailor used a sextant to find his position at sea.
meanings.sent2: The sextant helped the captain navigate the ship under the starry sky.
meanings.sent3: When the pirate mistook the sextant for a telescope, he ended up lost at sea.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was her sextant, guiding her through life's uncertainties.
meanings.sent5: The sextant gleamed in the sunlight, a tool of precision and adventure.

meanings.definition: A sixth part of a circle or sphere, equal to 60 degrees.
meanings.sent1: The angle of the sector was one sextant of the full circle.
meanings.sent2: The sextant of the pie he ate was exactly one-sixth.
meanings.sent3: The cake was divided into six equal parts, each a sextant of the whole.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up her face like a sextant of joy in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The sextant of the moon's glow illuminated the night sky with a gentle light.
